definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: Disclosed is an automatic sounding and counting instrument for pulse which is a medical apparatus suitable for feeling the pulse in traditional Chinese medical treatment.
sentences.chinese: 脉搏自动发声计数仪是一种适于中医切脉的医疗器具。

sentences.english: Palpation consists of two parts: feeling the pulse and taking the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 切脉包括脉诊和切脉两个部队份。

sentences.english: Palpation consists of two parts: feeling the pulse and taking the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 切脉包括脉诊和切脉两个部队份。

definition: to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
(TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
(TCM) observation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
to feel the pulse/to take sb's pulse

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
(TCM) auscultation and smelling, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to apply a treatment/to undertake a therapy
